summary.title: Freelance Java & JavaScript senior engineer, technical leader
summary.about:
Full stack web engineer, currently working mainly on React, React Native and NodeJS projects, but having also skills in Angular and Java.
Partisan of automating all that can be done, including tests at every level.
Participant and organizer of software craftsmanship events.

accomplishments.description:
As a member of a 10-person agile team, I contributed to the development of API and UI micro-services for Cegedim's next health insurance solution.

working environment:
- Test Driven Development,
- Pair-programming,
- Continuous integration and delivery,
- Automated tests on both API and UI parts,
- Agile methodology

I implemented a cross-platform mobile app for optic patients, including deployment to Android Play Store, using React Native,
the associated web portal for opticians
the corresponding NodeJS back-end

As a consultant on behalf of Celad, I developed a connector between PayZen (Lyra's online payment solution) and south-american payment methods:
- analysis of south-american payment methods API
- implementation of the connector
- integration to PayZen
As a consultant on behalf of Celad, I was in charge of technical coaching and development in a 5-member team, creating web applications for the Credit department (CCO).

jobs.title: Part-time teacher
jobs.client: Centre universitaire de formation et de recherche Champollion

accomplishments.description:
Supervision of tutored projects for students in their final year of engineering school.
By pair, the students developed an autonomous application of a hospital information system (admission, radiology, pharmacy, invoicing...).

Students objectives : 
- learn and apply Java development principles and service-oriented architecture, 
- learn and apply quality standards in coding as Test Driven Development and JUnit, 
- applying lessons concerning the architecture of health information systems (presentation of a means of interconnecting independent applications: Mule ESB).

At each session, a part of lecture to present the functional and technical aspects to be implemented during the session, then a practical part to advance the development of applications. I was then involved in technical support.

Technologies taught: #Java #Hibernate #JUnit #GWT #MySQL #SOA #TDD #Git

ISIS: Informatics and Health Information Systems. Engineering school of Castres, belonging to Champollion university center (Albi - Castres - Rodez, south west of France).

Achievements: Students voted for that course as the best teaching and the best teacher, both years I have been in the position.

jobs.title: JEE software engineer, then project manager

accomplishments.description: Assigned to PGIH department (PGIH is an ERP for french hospitals), I was in charge of developing and managing 300 to 3000 man-days projects, 3 to 5 persons.

Assigned to PGIH department (PGIH is an ERP for french hospitals), I managed ESPIC project: a top-priority project of 15 man-years over 18 months
consisting in the evolution of PGIH to fit private health establishments,
Achievements: on-time delivery, quality and client satisfaction objectives achieved.
On behalf of Artware, I was in charge of new web application development in 3-to-6-member teams.

realisations.name: Sumofages
realisations.context:
Web application to sum ages of several persons and give the date when this sum reaches the expected age.

Splitted in a NPM library for computation and a single page application. Both are in continuous integration, UI is in continuous delivery.

Unit tests with Jest, end-to-end tests with Cypress.io
objectives: practice Flow type for typed React

realisations.name: Scores
realisations.context: Hybrid mobile application that allows you to mark scores of different board games.
